title: Russia stepping up cyber espionage against US and allies
description: Russian intelligence agencies have increased their efforts to hack US and allied government computer networks to gather intelligence since the war in Ukraine began, Microsoft said in new findings published Wednesday.

title: Barack and Michelle Obama ink deal with Amazon's Audible
description: The Obamas are heading to Audible.

title: New Covid subvariants escape antibodies, studies suggest, but vaccines expected to protect against serious disease
Putin says Russia is rerouting trade to China and India
description: • Analysis: Beijing's BRICS summit puts Putin back on world stage

title: Ukraine may have endured its worst week since the fall of Mariupol
Putin says Russia is rerouting trade to China and India
'Need a ride?': Helpful citizen helps cop chase suspect
description: Officer takes helpful citizen up on his offer for a ride during an active foot chase to capture a suspect.  CNN affiliate WFAA reports.

title: Hear Biden's message to gas companies after appeal for gas tax holiday
description: President Joe Biden appealed directly to gas companies to lower their prices to give relief to Americans during a speech in which he called on Congress to suspend gas taxes for three months.

title: US Senate poised to pass first major gun safety legislation since 1994
description: The Senate on Tuesday made meaningful progress toward passing the first major federal gun safety legislation in nearly a generation.

title: Meet the pups headed to the Westminster Dog Show final
description: The Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show is afoot, which marks one of the few events where we can ogle photos of adorable dogs and feel kind of classy about it.

title: Ukrainian journalist 'executed in cold blood,' report says
description: Pro-journalist and free speech non-government organization Reporters Without Borders (RSF) says it has evidence that Russian soldiers executed journalist Maks Levin in a forest near Kyiv on March 13.

title: More than 1,000 people killed in eastern Afghanistan earthquake
description: A magnitude 5.9 earthquake hit eastern Afghanistan Wednesday, according to the United States Geological Survey (USGS).

title: The adventurer twins exploring the most remote parts of the world
description: They've already rowed across the Atlantic, flown over Australia with paramotors and traveled to some of the world's most remote places.

title: This Republican Senator's explanation on pushing fake electors makes no sense
description: If you blinked -- or looked away from your TV for a minute -- you might have missed it.

title: NYPD bulldozes nearly 100 illegal motorbikes and ATVs
description: New York City leaders demolished close to 100 motorbikes and ATVs, sending a message they are cracking down on dangerous, illegal vehicles.

title: Site 'overlooked for over 90 years' was home to some of Britain's earliest humans
description: Hand axes unearthed from a riverbed in the county of Kent in southeast England have revealed one of the earliest known Stone Age communities in northern Europe.

title: Ukraine's defense of the last city in the Luhansk region it still holds just became a lot more tenuous
description: Ukraine's defense of Lysychansk -- the last city in the Luhansk region it still holds -- just became a lot more tenuous.

title: Baltimore Ravens linebacker Jaylon Ferguson dies aged 26
description: Baltimore Ravens outside linebacker Jaylon Ferguson has died, the NFL team announced on Wednesday. He was 26.

title: First test of Johnson's popularity since narrow vote in Parliament
description: CNN's Bianca Nobilo looks at two local elections in small English cities that could be a sign of things to come for UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson.

title: 'Obi-Wan Kenobi' threaded the needle between 'Revenge of the Sith' and 'A New Hope'
description: Facing an even more formidable task than "Rogue One: A Star Wars Story," "Obi-Wan Kenobi" deftly threaded the needle between "Revenge of the Sith" and "A New Hope" in the "Star Wars" timeline, filling its finale with enough action and callbacks to cap off a highly satisfying and hugely nostalgic run.

title: Mayim Bialik's experience with Covid-19 is 'no joke'
description: Mayim Bialik has tested positive for Covid-19 and says it's been rough.

title: Summer starts in Europe with new Covid wave
description: European countries are seeing a significant increase in Covid-19 cases spurred by highly infectious subvariants of Omicron, raising fears of a new global wave of the disease as immunity declines and the summer travel season gets underway.

title: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman visits Turkey for first time since Khashoggi murder
description: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman has landed in the Turkish capital, Ankara, for a first visit to the country since the 2018 murder of journalist Jamal Khashoggi at the kingdom's Istanbul consulate.

title: Is there any way out of Israel's neverending election cycle?
description: It was just over a year ago that a shared desire to oust Benjamin Netanyahu as the longest-serving Israeli prime minister united eight disparate political parties to form the most diverse coalition in Israeli history. They succeeded - but it may be short-lived.

title: Remember when Elvis Presley's white jumpsuits changed how men dressed forever?
description: When Elvis Presley made broadcasting history in 1973, he was dressed in a white bell-bottomed jumpsuit, embellished with a bald eagle made from red, gold and blue studs. As the Memphis singer crooned away on a stage in Honolulu, his concert "Aloha from Hawaii" was being simultaneously broadcast in 40 different countries.

title: Plane crash-lands in Miami after landing gear failure
description: A plane crash-landed and caught on fire on a Miami International Airport runway after its landing gear collapsed. Three people were hospitalized with minor injuries. CNN's Carlos Suarez reports.

title: Beyoncé's single dubbed anthem for 'Great Resignation'
description: CNN's Chloe Melas breaks down why Beyoncé's latest single may inspire fans to give up their jobs.

title: This airplane seat could be the future of business class
description: As wireless headphones become increasingly omnipresent, standard-issue airline headphones with their tangled cables and multi-pronged jack plugs seem increasingly outdated.

title: Could a housing slump threaten the stock market and the entire economy?
description: The red-hot housing market is starting to show signs of cooling off. Prices have spiked to levels unaffordable for many prospective buyers, and mortgage rates have jumped following the Federal Reserve's rate hikes and a surge in bond yields.

title: Red Bull Racing suspends junior driver Juri Vips after racist slur on live gaming stream
description: Red Bull Racing has suspended junior driver Juri Vips after he used a racial slur during a live gaming stream on Tuesday.

title: These are the lengths Chinese developers are going to in order to sell homes
description: Some Chinese property developers are going to extreme lengths to attract buyers.

title: Qualifying for Wimbledon could be the biggest payday of these players' careers
description: It's unmistakably a scene from the British summer: across a stretch of green, well-kept courts, tennis players shoot balls over the net as spectators -- some seated, some sprawled on grass banks -- watch on in the lazy afternoon heat.

title: Photographer captures mesmerizing images of Mexico's iconic bird
description: Since he was four years old, photographer Claudio Contreras Koob has been obsessed with flamingos: their vibrant pink feathers, horn-like curved beaks, and elegant, poised necks.

title: Activist who said Xi Jinping 'not smart enough' tried in secret for subversion
description: A prominent civil rights advocate in China who once called on leader Xi Jinping to resign because he is "just not smart enough" was put on trial behind closed doors Wednesday on charges of subverting state power.

title: Naomi Osaka and LeBron James launch new media company
description: Four-time major winner Naomi Osaka is launching a new media company in partnership with NBA superstar LeBron James, the tennis star has announced.

title: The United Kingdom has the highest inflation in the G7
description: Soaring food prices pushed British consumer price inflation to a 40-year high of 9.1% last month, the highest rate out of the Group of Seven countries and underlining the severity of the cost-of-living crunch.

title: Russian and Chinese warships spotted near Japanese territory as apparent pressure mounts
description: At least eight Russian and Chinese warships have been spotted in the seas near Japan this week, another sign of the apparent pressure the two partners have been putting on Tokyo as relations deteriorate over Ukraine and Taiwan respectively.

title: Millions affected after deadly floods hit India and Bangladesh
description: Millions of people across India and Bangladesh have been affected by raging floods and landslides that left more than 100 people dead and entire communities devastated.

title: US school principal charged with 30 counts of sexual contact with a student
description: A high school principal in Pennsylvania has been charged with 30 counts of sexual intercourse and contact with a student, according to court documents filed Monday.

title: Arundhati Roy on Prophet Mohammed remarks
description: When two spokespeople from India's ruling Hindu nationalist Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) made derogatory comments about the Prophet Mohammed last month, it prompted an international firestorm.

title: Total of 29 Chinese warplanes sent into skies near Taiwan
description: • Expert: China's military aggression on Taiwan will be 'incredible calamity'

title: Nepal may move Everest Base Camp
description: Nepal is considering relocating Everest Base Camp due to environmental concerns.

title: Same county tops healthiest US community ranking for the third year in a row
description: As the country navigates a more controlled phase of the pandemic, Los Alamos County, New Mexico, has been ranked the healthiest US community for the third year in a row.

title: Exposure to any light during sleep linked to obesity and serious health issues, study finds
description: Even dim light can disrupt sleep, raising the risk of serious health issues in older adults, a new study found.

title: Taiwan accuses China of bullying over World Cup name change
description: Taiwan accused China of bullying on Monday after organizers of the World Cup in Qatar again changed the reference for Taiwanese visitors applying for an identification card that doubles as an entry visa to list their nationality as "Chinese Taipei".

title: Meta launches online store to purchase clothes for your avatar
description: Zuckerberg the fashionista gets mocked for modeling designer clothes you can now buy to dress your avatar. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.
